title: Racist chanting mars Lazio's win over Roma as stadium announcer PLEADS with supporters to stop vile abuse
text:

Lazio beat Roma 2-0 in the first leg of their Coppa Italia semi-final but the clash at the Stadio Olimpico was marred by racist chanting. 
Sergej Milinkovic-Savic and Ciro Immobile were on the scoresheet for Lazio as they recorded a win over their city rivals for the first time in eight meetings. 
Roma's German defender Antonio Rudiger was subjected to racial abuse from opposing fans throughout the first half. 
The stadium announcer was forced to intervene and said the game would be interrupted if the chanting continued. Read More Roma's Antonio Rudiger (back) was subjected to racial abuse by Lazio fans (Photo: AFP) Roma were soundly beaten by their city rivals in the Stadio Olimpico (Photo: Paolo Bruno) Lazio's players celebrate after their victory (Photo: Rex Features) 
The vile chanting subdued after that and the match was completed, with Lazio running out deserved winners. 
Roma's end of the stadium remained deserted throughout the encounter as supporters of the Giallorossi continued their protest against new security measures at the stadium. Read More Serbian football chief tells racially abused rival player to "go back to Brazil and show your dark fingers" 
Authorities installed partitions at on the Curva Sud (South Curve) of the stadium in a bid to make it safer but fans claim the partitions block their view of the match and divide supporters. 
Lazio took the lead in the first half when Milinkovic-Savid turned home a Felipe Anderson cut-back before Immobile scored in similar fashion after the interval, netting from close range after good work from Keita Balde Diao down the right. Like us on Facebook
